channel.title: Looking to build computer $1200 USD
channel.description:
So I am going to be building another PC here I want to have it done by the 31st. I have 1200 to work with but I already have some stuff picked out.
Case: Corsair Graphite Series 600T $159.99 - $139.99 After Rebate PSU: CORSAIR Professional Series HX650 $109.99 - $89.99 After Rebate CPU Cooler: Trusty Old H50? (84.66)?
This leaves $845.36
What I want
I need a fast fucking processor (i7???) A reliable and feature loaded motherboard that can support all the connectors on the case (ASUS?) A good amount of reliable and compatible ram for that motherboard (?) A reliable SSD to hold the main operating system (30-60GB?) A decent video card (doesnt have to be top notch but should be able to run new games at pretty good settings) If there is still money left over I am thinking 1TB harddrive?
Let me know what you guys come up with. I am doing my own research but there is so many options for motherboards, ram, video cards and I havent been keeping up recently. I can probably squeeze another $100 dollars in if need be
Update: So definitely Intel Core i7-2600K because it seems like the best core i7 for the price according the benchmarks, but picking out the RAM and a reliable motherboard is the hardpart
OKAY: So heres what I have come up with so far http://secure.newegg.com/WishList/PublicWishDetail.aspx?WishListNumber=22719927
Still missing SSD and Hard Drive though

item.title: Looking to build computer $1200 USD
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

`Discardedx2`:

not sure why you guys spend so much money on computers for them to be outdated in 16-18 months…

you mean 36+ months

and at the end of 36 months they’ll still be fairly decent better than average gaming computers

at the end of 5 years they might show signs of dating but will still be more powerful than most low end boxes made from 2017 and previous

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to build computer $1200 USD
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

`Discardedx2`:

not sure why you guys spend so much money on computers for them to be outdated in 16-18 months…

I don’t know how you figure that at all? I have a Intel Q9450 that I paid about $300 dollars for about 3ish? years ago and it still is a very good processor, better than most you can find unless we start talking core i5’s and i7’s or new AMD Phenom X4’s and higher. And for the core i7 2600k to be only $300 dollars and be at the very top of CPU benchmarks I think it will still be a very good processor in 3-4 years.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @_Discardedx21 `Discardedx2`

item.title: Looking to build computer $1200 USD
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:1, topic:426810”]Just as an update parts are coming on the 28th and I ordered some more stuff.

Different GTX 570 http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004MN3HBA/ref=oh_o00_s00_i06_details
Some cables (cosmetics)
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003TSCZV2/ref=oh_o00_s00_i00_details
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0036ORCJY/ref=oh_o00_s00_i01_details
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0036ORCHG/ref=oh_o00_s00_i02_details
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004DCAMKY/ref=oh_o00_s00_i03_details
Different Water Cooler:
H70 Core http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B005QUQP8U/ref=oh_o00_s00_i04_details
Fans for Water Cooler: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003AVMRPM/ref=oh_o00_s00_i05_details

My order for the H50 never went through and I realized I wanted a card with better cooling and didnt need the extra memory so i will be returning the evga one.[/quote]

BTW I have this beast built, will be posting pictures in a new thread later.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to build computer $1200 USD
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:8, topic:426152”][quote author=Classic_ link=topic=528844.msg3859714#msg3859714 date=1324594908]

if you can afford it, swap the 560 ti for a 570, get the absolute cheapest 1600mhz ddr3 memory you can, and the ssd you picked only has 95mb/s write speed, decent ssds would have both 500mb read write speeds

Change motherboard to an MSI Z68A-GD65 (G3) and SSD to an OCZ Vertex 3. I know for a fact they’re compatible as it’s what i use in my PC, some controllers have a tendency to not play nice.

Okay whats listed in the wishlist now is what I ordered. I didnt want to get the MSI board cause I was really deadset on the ASUS board (brand loyalty) and I didnt want the OCZ Vertex 3 because the reviews I was reading werent that good but im guessing you have had good experience with them otherwise you wouldnt have recommended it to me. But I did take the GTX 470 even though it was a bit far priced and I did pick a SSD that had good read/write speed. So the final price came out too around ~$1700 USD. I added a bluray bruner also.

You forgot HD, and if you went over your budget, how will you get one?

? I have a ssd and a disk hard drive. My budget is unlimited anyway I just wanted to keep it in that range as to not spend to much on a computer as tech is changing constantly.

Oh, you have one in handy? What I usually do is buy a smaller HD for the computer itself because I always have a few externals lying around, most 1TB.
[/quote]

No, there is a SSD and a HD in the wish list.[/quote]
Ah I see, thought it is only 250 GB.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to build computer $1200 USD

But I did take the GTX 470 even though it was a bit far priced and I did pick a SSD that had good read/write speed. So the final price came out too around ~$1700 USD. I added a bluray bruner also.

Oh, you have one in handy? What I usually do is buy a smaller HD for the computer itself because I always have a few externals lying around, most 1TB. :P[/quote]

No, there is a SSD and a HD in the wish list.

item.title: Looking to build computer $1200 USD
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Niall:

if you can afford it, swap the 560 ti for a 570, get the absolute cheapest 1600mhz ddr3 memory you can, and the ssd you picked only has 95mb/s write speed, decent ssds would have both 500mb read write speeds

Speljohan:

Change motherboard to an MSI Z68A-GD65 (G3) and SSD to an OCZ Vertex 3. I know for a fact they’re compatible as it’s what i use in my PC, some controllers have a tendency to not play nice.

Okay whats listed in the wishlist now is what I ordered. I didnt want to get the MSI board cause I was really deadset on the ASUS board (brand loyalty) and I didnt want the OCZ Vertex 3 because the reviews I was reading werent that good but im guessing you have had good experience with them otherwise you wouldnt have recommended it to me. But I did take the GTX 470 even though it was a bit far priced and I did pick a SSD that had good read/write speed. So the final price came out too around ~$1700 USD. I added a bluray bruner also.

Read full topic
